title: "Kamel Chenaouy" guitar logo, 25 years old
content:
Hi, I’m working for a client whose logo has been put on guitars for 25 years now. [This is what it looks like](http://web.archive.org/web/20081208085145/http:/img530.imageshack.us/my.php?image=logokcpourkcproductsclif4.gif).  
1. Does somebody have an idea if its a hand madet type or a specific typeface?  
2. Does this type have a name or an equivalent.

I thank you all for your help. \0/

 [‹ (x) Guys and Dolls movie poster - Kabel, Romeo {Jan E, Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081208085145/http:/typophile.com/node/36862 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Phyllis Road unusual serif italic - Cochin {Eric Gordon} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081208085145/http:/typophile.com/node/36872 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Biaxident

comments.content: This looks like a typeface that has had some customization.
Yes that’s right, I’ve been asking around. It seems to be a typeface that was on old PCs (1980 onwards) which had been modified.
I believe this is a customized ITC Cheltenham Book Italic.

Bald Condensed, I think that you hit the nail right on the head. :-)  
Kamel Chenaouy is well known for his Apex guitars and other creations in the guitar world. He also has a forum where he advises budding luthiers on how to build one’s own guitars. Its here: [http://kamelchenaouy.forumactif.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081208085145/http:/kamelchenaouy.forumactif.com/ "http://kamelchenaouy.forumactif.com/").  
Thanks for everything.

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081208085145im_/http:/typophile.com/files/final-2_3759.gif)
  
This is the new logo design process.
